newsitem.title: USA: Star Technologies moves to broader imaging market.
newsitem.headline: Star Technologies moves to broader imaging market.

text.p: Star Technologies Inc said Wednesday that it has acquired document imaging technology and certain other assets from Intrafed Inc for $1.9 million, and up to 2.6 million shares of Star common stock, based in part on future performance.
The company said it undertook the action because it is refocusing its business from the medical imaging market to the broader document imaging market.

With the acquisition, Star said it has also formed PowerScan Inc, an operating subsidiary to further develop and market Intrafed's document capture and processing products. Intrafed is a provider of software for high-speed, high-volume document capture and processing.

Star also said that it has sold its Medical Image Management Systems technology to CompuRAD Inc. The transaction, said Star, is valued at up to $1.4 million, including 100,000 shares of CompuRAD stock and royalties on future software sales for a five-year period.
